name: Whisler's
description: East Austin craft cocktail bar in a vintage building with a mezcaleria upstairs and seasonal drink menu.
longDescription: Whisler's is the cocktail bar that put East Austin on the national drinks map. Housed in a characterful vintage building on East 6th, the bar features a seasonal cocktail menu crafted with house-made syrups, fresh juices, and quality spirits. The upstairs mezcaleria, Mezcaleria Tobala, is a hidden gem specializing in rare mezcals. The outdoor patio is one of Austin's best spots for warm evening drinks. The atmosphere strikes the perfect balance between craft cocktail seriousness and Austin's laid-back attitude.
tips: Patio is the place to be

name: The Roosevelt Room
description: Sophisticated downtown cocktail bar with historically inspired drinks and elegant 1920s ambiance.
longDescription: The Roosevelt Room brings pre-Prohibition cocktail culture to downtown Austin with an encyclopedic menu organized by era—from the 1800s through today. The bartenders are true craftspeople, wielding vintage techniques alongside modern innovation. The elegant space features low lighting, leather seating, and the kind of atmosphere that makes you sit up a little straighter and savor every sip. It's Austin's most serious cocktail bar, but the staff keeps the experience accessible and welcoming.

name: Garage
description: Multi-level Rainey Street bar with rooftop views, DJs, and energetic weekend atmosphere.
longDescription: Garage is a Rainey Street anchor, offering multiple levels of entertainment from ground-floor bar to rooftop lounge. The rooftop views of downtown Austin's skyline are stunning, especially at sunset. DJs spin on weekends, keeping the energy high, while weeknight happy hours offer a more relaxed vibe. The space is modern and well-designed, with indoor and outdoor areas on every level. It's a go-to for groups looking for a lively night out.

name: Half Step
description: Relaxed Rainey Street cocktail bar with expert bartenders, live music, and a friendly neighborhood feel.
longDescription: Half Step is the Rainey Street cocktail bar for people who don't love Rainey Street's party scene. This neighborhood-feeling bar occupies one of the historic bungalows and focuses on well-crafted cocktails in a relaxed, unpretentious atmosphere. The bartenders are among Austin's best, and the live music—often jazz or blues—adds sophistication without drowning out conversation. The covered patio with string lights is one of the most pleasant drinking spots in the city.
tips: Less hectic than other Rainey bars

name: Hotel San Jose
description: Minimalist boutique hotel bar on South Congress with a lush courtyard and Austin's coolest crowd.
longDescription: The bar at Hotel San Jose is Austin cool distilled into a drinking experience. This Liz Lambert-designed boutique hotel on South Congress features a lush, secluded courtyard where fashionable locals and visitors sip wine and craft cocktails among tropical plants and string lights. The vibe is distinctly Austin—effortlessly stylish without being pretentious. The wine list is thoughtful, the cocktails are simple but well-made, and the people-watching is unmatched. It's where you go when you want to feel the pulse of South Congress culture.

name: Lustre Pearl
description: Original Rainey Street bar that kicked off the district's transformation, with a spacious yard and party atmosphere.
longDescription: Lustre Pearl is the bar that started the Rainey Street revolution. Before the high-rises and crowds, Lustre Pearl opened in a converted bungalow and proved that Rainey Street could become Austin's next great bar district. The massive backyard, multiple bars, and regular DJ sets create a party atmosphere that's quintessentially Austin. While the neighborhood has changed dramatically around it, Lustre Pearl retains the energy and welcoming attitude that made it popular in the first place.

name: The White Horse
description: East Austin honky-tonk with live country music, two-stepping, and free dance lessons on the best dance floor in town.
longDescription: The White Horse is Austin's best honky-tonk, period. This East Austin bar keeps the Texas dancehall tradition alive with nightly live country, Americana, and roots music on a proper wooden dance floor. Free two-step lessons early in the evening get beginners moving, and by 10 PM the floor is packed with dancers of all skill levels. The atmosphere is genuinely inclusive—cowboys and hipsters, regulars and tourists, all sharing the dance floor. The drinks are cheap, the music is real, and the energy is electric.
tips: Wear boots if you have them

name: Meanwhile Brewing Co.
description: Southeast Austin brewery with massive outdoor space, food trucks, and family-friendly weekend atmosphere.
longDescription: Meanwhile Brewing Co. has created one of Austin's best outdoor gathering spaces—a sprawling, beautifully landscaped property in Southeast Austin where craft beer, food trucks, live music, and community converge. The beer program focuses on approachable, well-crafted styles perfect for the Texas climate. The grounds are genuinely huge, with room for dogs, kids, and groups of any size. Weekend afternoons feel like a neighborhood festival, with food trucks rotating and live music on the outdoor stage.

name: Firehouse Lounge
description: Hidden speakeasy behind a bookshelf in a historic firehouse with craft cocktails and live jazz.
longDescription: Firehouse Lounge is Austin's most enchanting hidden bar. Housed in a historic downtown firehouse, the entrance is concealed behind a bookshelf that swings open to reveal a dimly lit cocktail lounge. The craft cocktails are expertly made, live jazz plays most evenings, and the atmosphere is intimate and romantic. The firehouse architecture—exposed brick, vintage fixtures—creates a uniquely Austin experience that feels both historic and thoroughly modern.

name: Scholz Garten
description: Texas's oldest operating beer garden since 1866, with German tradition, cold beer, and UT game-day energy.
longDescription: Scholz Garten is a living piece of Texas history—the oldest continuously operating business in Austin and one of the oldest biergartens in America, open since 1866. The massive outdoor biergarten, complete with long communal tables and towering oak trees, is where Austin has gathered for over 150 years. On UT football Saturdays, the energy is electric. On quiet weekday evenings, the pace is gentle and the conversation flows freely. German-style food, cold beer, and a sense of continuity with Austin's past make this a must-visit.

name: Small Victory
description: Cozy South Austin cocktail bar with expertly crafted drinks, warm hospitality, and neighborhood charm.
longDescription: Small Victory is the kind of neighborhood bar every neighborhood deserves. This cozy South Austin spot serves expertly crafted cocktails in a warm, inviting atmosphere. The bartenders are passionate about their craft but never pretentious—they'll happily make you a simple highball or guide you through something more adventurous. The small space creates an intimate feel where conversations flow easily. Regular events and a rotating cocktail menu keep things interesting for the loyal neighborhood crowd.

name: Container Bar
description: Unique Rainey Street bar built from stacked shipping containers with multiple levels and open-air design.
longDescription: Container Bar is one of the most visually striking bars on Rainey Street—and in Austin. Built from stacked shipping containers arranged in a multi-level, open-air configuration, the bar is an architectural statement that doubles as a party destination. Multiple bars, a DJ booth, and varied seating areas mean there's always room to find your vibe. The industrial design, neon lights, and open-air format create an atmosphere that's uniquely Austin.
